result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J Burgess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J Burgess

defendant.name: Burgess, Randy J
defendant.address: 916 E Wall Street, Apt. 11, Eagle  River, WI 54521

records.addlTxt: Returned Mail-Intent Debt to WI Department of Revenue
Returned Mail-Notice Intent Debt to WI Department of Revenue

2:35 PM Defendant Randy J Burgess in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Randy J Burgess.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached.  Count 1: Plea of not contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Court orders 12 months jail- 105 days credit, concurrent to any other sentence being served.  Court costs imposed in the sum of $518, due to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days or payment arrangements made.  Felony advisements given.

Defendant Randy J Burgess appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared by video for Randy J Burgess.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre trial for May 31st at 2:15 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on May 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Randy J Burgess appeared by video, Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared by video for Randy J Burgess, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court modifies bond to $2500.00 signature bond. Conditions, curfew 7pm to 6 am at the Wall St. address unless work related issues arise. Attorney Jolin waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court sets preliminary for March 23rd at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will adjourns this matter to February 22nd at 1:30 pm to allow time for criminal complaint. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets $1000.00 cash bond. No specific conditions. Court sets initial appearance to February 21st at 9:00 am.
